title: SARTRE cover type
content:
hi there typophiles,  
I was wondering whether anyone recognises this little beauty…  
I’m sure I’m going to end up kicking myself.

many thanks in advance,  
pete

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sartre.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20061116104549/http:/typophile.com/files/sartre.jpg) | 20.71 KB |
author: mr_cheese

comments.content:
SARTRE cover type+  
Just a little more info on this face : I believe that it comes from a book published by Gallimard in France in or around 2005. The face makes me think of Garage gothic, which also has this slightly rounded feel. But this particular face is also slightly more angular, for example in the construction of the R, or in the S. I’ve checked the T-26 listing, and there are a couple of slightly similar faces by Jim Marcus (Arete Mono and Tempus gothic), but neither corresponds exactly.  
thanks again,  
pete
Very nice, maybe it wasn’t digital ?—it reminds me a face by Jim Parkinson.

It looks quite a bit like Canada Type’s revival of ‘Signum’ by Georg Trump that they call [Trump Gothic.](http://web.archive.org/web/20061116104549/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/trump-gothic/). Look at the Bold weights set in the letters ‘SARTRE’. The A is a bit different in width, but the overall appearance is quite similar, I think.

- Mike Yanega
